intro: Epilobium trichoneurum, commonly known as the hairy willow herb, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy soils along riverbanks and wet meadows. The plant features slender, erect stems with glandular hairs and produces small, pink or purple flowers in clusters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine, soft hairs. Epilobium trichoneurum is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support biodiversity.
